instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R6990: What is R6990? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on Macbooks from around the year 2012. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground but no on components?
threads.message:
hi guys,
having a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board, short on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.
removed F6905. short is on the pin2 still.

I checked and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> go to few places, then I removed almost all the components connected to it,including <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR>.
but still short to ground. it's "0" in diode mode.

Look around and see like broken trace on one of the usb port, seems like it's dropped with something plugged in,and  the very top layer of PCB has a crack.
L4705 removed, and pin2 is still shorted to ground. removed <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>, still shorted to ground


so found two shorts now, <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_USB_B_ILIM</SIGNAL>

I tried injecting power to <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>, only 1. sth Voltage already got the Amp to almost 5A.

and nothing is really hot on board but the clam from the DC machine.


doubting on the PCB layers maybe short and damaged? anyway to fix case like this?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground but no on components?
threads.message: I've seen that before, short in the PCB. RIP....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground but no on components?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground but no on components?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground but no on components?
threads.message: It is not RIP if the short was just on PPDCIN, but <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> to the USB is also shorted. I had a board with the exact issue too, isolated the shorts and it turned on but was brain dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground but no on components?
threads.message:
yea i know that drill method too, but the thing is that, you don't even know where the short spot is , so no way to drill. the short is inside the PCB layers.
it looks perfectly fine physically, no like those with burnt black spots..
